dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool is used to attribute the line network by Strahler stream order. The output is a line network that is dissolved by sections between stream confluences. These attributes can then be transferred to any Strahler is a useful attribute for improving line network routes.

tool.name: StreamOrderTool

param.name: InputStreamNetwork
param.dialogReference:
The line network used to generate stream order.

Requirements Include:

* Projected Coordinate System, not Geographic.

* All appropriate lines are connected as a network. This can be checked by running [Network Connectivity Tool](/KellyWhitehead/geomorphic-network-and-analysis-toolbox/wiki/Tool_Documentation/NetworkConnectivity) and rejoining broken lines

* All braids removed. Braids will cause the tool to get stuck in a loop. Braids can be identified and isolated by running the Find Braids in Network Tool. Only one braid section should be identified as the main channel and retained. The connector segments and side channel should be removed. (GNIS name can be used as a guide to identify the main channel, too).

* File GDB Polyline Feature Class (due to field requirements)

* is NOT be Z or M enabled.

param.name: outputStreamOrderFC
param.displayname: Output Line Network with Stream Order
param.dialogReference:
This is the name and location (in a fgdb) of the new line feature class that contains the stream order.

This output will contain the same attributes as the Input Stream Network, with the addition of a `StreamOrder` Field.

param.name: outputJunctionPointsFC
param.dialogReference: This is the name and location (in a fgdb) of the new point feature class of the locations of stream order transitions (used for splitting tributaries, see post processing step).

param.name: InputTempWorkspace
param.dialogReference:
You may use:

1. Create a new file GDB to save temporary processing files (useful for debugging).

3. If a workspace is not designated, the tool will use the "in_memory" workspace. You will not be able to view the temporary files, _but the processing speed will be much faster_.

tool.summary: This tool is used to attribute the line network by Strahler stream order. The output is a line network that is dissolved by sections between stream confluences. These attributes can then be transferred to any Strahler is a useful attribute for improving line network routes.
